page.title: 02GRID REFERENCE 03960144
page.content: Topography and Settlement The area lies across rolling chalk downland on the southern edge of Salisbury Plain. Ninety per cent of the area falls within the Military Training area, however the remaining ten per cent and a third of the Military holding is used for agriculture. A winterbourne at a mean elevation of 95 metres runs into Chitterne in the south east from the north. The highest point of land is 183 metres. The village is bisected by the southern boundary, and there is no other habitation in the area. The total population of the village is 200, with shop, church, racing stables, pub, small garage and a builder's business, although only the three former and roughly half the population are situated in this area.
